quote: People think focus means saying yes to the thing you've got to focus on. But that's not what it means at all. It means saying no to the hundred other good ideas that there are. You have to pick carefully. I'm actually as proud of the things we haven't done as the things I have done. Innovation is saying no to 1,000 things.
Computers are useless, they can only give you answers.
The true test of character is not how much we know how to do, but how we behave when we don't know what to do.
Property may be destroyed and money may lose its purchasing power; but character, health, knowledge and good judgment will always be in demand under all conditions.

One ought never to turn one's back on a threatened danger and try to run away from it. If you do that, you will double the danger. But if you meet it promptly and without flinching you will reduce the danger by half. Never run away from anything.
Democracy is a form of government that substitutes election by the incompetent many for appointment by the corrupt few.
Work is the refuge of people who have nothing better to do.
To every man is given the key to the gates of heaven; the same key opens the gates of hell.
Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.
A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
Adversity does not build character, it reveals it.
The Road to Hell is paved with good intentions.
All that is required for evil to prevail is for good men to do nothing.
Show me the man and I'll find you the crime.
The only man who never makes a mistake is the man who never does anything.

Remember that man lives only in the present, in this fleeting instant; all the rest of his life is either past and gone, or not yet revealed. Short, therefore, is man's life, and narrow is the corner of the earth wherein he dwells.
We never know the worth of water till the well is dry.
A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort.
The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
Men never do evil so completely and cheerfully as when they do it from religious conviction.
The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wise people so full of doubt.

He is your friend, your partner, your defender, your dog. You are his life, his love, his leader. He will be yours, faithful and true, to the last beat of his heart. You owe it to him to be worthy of such devotion.
I honestly think it is better to be a failure at something you love than to be a success at something you hate.
The worst sin towards our fellow creatures is not to hate them, but to be indifferent to them. That's the essence of inhumanity.
It is better to be hated for what you are than be loved for what you are not.
Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
Never attribute to malice that which can be adequately explained by stupidity.
Success is just failure waiting to happen.
When opportunity knocks, bolt the door.
Good friends know when to keep quiet. Great friends don't talk at all.
Strangers are just enemies you haven't met yet.
When writing your own life story, be the villain.
Trying new things is a recipe for disappointment.
Why put off until tomorrow what you can do never?
When things are looking bright, try closing the blinds.
Don't forget, every silver lining is part of a larger darker cloud.
Having a sibling around is like being forced to constantly look in a mirror at an inferior version of yourself.
Remind people that if they ever need anything, your door is never open.
Celebrating the holidays with your family is a good way to make sure no one has a good time.
The best vacations are the ones you tell your family about only after you've left.
If you see a rainbow, take comfort in the fact that someone somewhere is getting rained on, perhaps even struck by lightning.
The great thing about the outdoors is that you can walk around for days and not see anyone.
Arguing with an Engineer is a lot like wrestling in the mud with a pig. After a couple of hours, you realize the pig likes it.
You never get away, you only get somewhere else.
Courage doesn't mean you don't get afraid. Courage means you don't let fear stop you.
The things you think about determine the quality of your mind. Your soul takes on the color of your thoughts.
The creation continues incessantly through the media of man. But man does not create, he discovers.
If you would keep your secret from an enemy, tell it not to a friend.
Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
I am an old man and have known a great many troubles, but most of them have never happened.
If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
A mind is like a parachute. It doesn't work if it is not open.

The wild things of this earth are not ours to do with as we please. They have been given to us in trust, and we must account for them to the generation which will come after us and audit our accounts.

To assume that every wild beast and bird is a sacred creature, peacefully dwelling in an earthly paradise, is a mistake. They have their wisdom and their folly, their joys and their sorrows, their trials and tribulations.

It is time for all men to be told in the plainest terms that there never has existed, anywhere in historic times, a volume of wildlife so great that civilized man could not quickly exterminate it by his methods of destruction.
He who knows the wild animals of the world always travels among friends, and in every land he finds a welcome.

Except within our conservation areas, an earthly paradise is being turned into an earthly Hades; and it is not savages nor primitive men who are doing this, but men and women who boast of their civilization.
Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.
When humans act with cruelty we characterize them as "animals", yet the only animal that displays cruelty is humanity.
One can find time for everything if one is never in a hurry.
Nobody should be whipped. Remember that, once and for all. Neither man nor animal can be influenced by anything but suggestion.

The joyful, keen and fearless otter; mild and loving to his own kind, and gentle with his neighbour of the stream; full of play and gladness in his life; full of courage in his stress; ideal in his home; steadfast in death; the noblest little soul that ever went four-footed through the woods.
Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
Political correctness does not legislate tolerance; it only organizes hatred.
He that plants trees, loves others besides himself.
The greatest threat to our planet is the belief that someone else will save it.
A savage is not the one who lives in the forest, but the one who destroys it.
It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
The greatest and most important problems of life are all fundamentally insoluble. They can never be solved but only outgrown.
The healthy man does not torture others; generally it is the tortured who turn into torturers.

Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better to take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.
Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
I am not what happened to me. I am what I choose to become.
In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.
You can't use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true.
Good breeding consists in concealing how much we think of ourselves and how little we think of the other person.
I don't care that they stole my idea; I care that they don't have any of their own
A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance.
Freedom is something that dies unless it's used.
A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
Everything has its limit ‚Äì iron ore cannot be educated into gold.
One of the most striking differences between a cat and a lie is that a cat has only nine lives.
The more things are forbidden, the more popular they become.
It is difficult to get a man to understand something when his salary depends upon his not understanding it.
I'm suspicious of people who don't like dogs, but I trust a dog when it doesn't like a person.
A writer never has a vacation. For a writer, life consists of either writing or thinking about writing.
It is not the answer that enlightens, but the question.
Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.
Let him that would move the world first move himself.
Start off every day with a smile and get it over with.
It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.
The first of April is the day we remember what we are the other 364 days of the year.
A sacrifice of privacy is also a sacrifice of democracy.
When you're under constant surveillance, you're in a prison.
The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has merely laid an egg cackles as if she had laid an asteroid.
Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks.
What is the difference between a taxidermist and a tax collector? The taxidermist takes only your skin.
We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented.
Law controls the lesser man, right conduct controls the greater one
One has not only a legal but a moral responsibility to obey just laws. Conversely, one has a moral responsibility to disobey unjust laws.
I think, from all I can learn, that heaven has the better climate, but hell has the better company.
Although other animals may be different from us, this does not make them less than us
The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
It is just like man's vanity and impertinence to call an animal dumb because it is dumb to his dull perceptions.
Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone, you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.

Let us keep our minds open by all means .... But don't keep your minds so open that your brains fall out! There are still things in this world which are true and things which are false; acts which are right and acts which are wrong, even if there are statesmen who hide their designs under the cloak of high-sounding phrases.
I have a very old and very faithful attachment for dogs. I like them because they always forgive.
Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal.
Science is a way of trying not to fool yourself. The first principle is that you must not fool yourself, and you are the easiest person to fool.
The truth is, most of us discover where we are headed when we arrive.
Without libraries what have we? We have no past and no future.
Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't.
All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, then success is sure.
There is no job so simple that it cannot be done wrong.
The question is, are we happy to suppose that our grandchildren may never be able to see an elephant except in a picture book?
If we disappeared overnight, the world would probably be better off.
Writing is thinking. To write well is to think clearly. That's why it's so hard.
Never, ever be afraid to make some noise and get in good trouble, necessary trouble.
If you live long enough, you'll see that every victory turns into a defeat.
Always borrow money from a pessimist, he won't expect it back.
Money can't buy you friends, but you can get a better class of enemy.
You can be young without money, but you can't be old without it.
Think of how stupid the average person is, and realize half of them are stupider than that.
Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps; for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are, and what they ought to be.
The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it emotionally.
In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life. It goes on.
One thing that humbles me deeply is to see that human genius has its limits while human stupidity does not.
Anything that has real and lasting value is always a gift from within.
I do not read advertisements. I would spend all of my time wanting things.
Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
There is considerable overlap between the intelligence of the smartest bears and the dumbest tourists.
The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
Both optimists and pessimists contribute to our society. The optimist invents the airplane and the pessimist the parachute.
The scariest moment is always just before you start.
citation: Stephen King (On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft)

quote: Pride is a master of deception; when you think you're occupied in the weightiest business, that's when it has you in its spell
It's silly to try to escape other people's faults, They are inescapable. Just try to escape your own.
Blame no one. Set people straight if you can. If not, just repair the damage. Suppose you can't do that either. Then where does blaming people get you?
Leave other people‚Äôs mistakes where they lie.
All that you see will soon have vanished, and those who see it vanish will vanish themselves, and the ones who reached old age have no advantage over the untimely dead.
Humanity knows nothing at all. There is no intrinsic value in anything, and every action is a futile, meaningless effort.

The more people do, the more society develops, the more problems arise. The increasing desolation of nature, the exhaustion of resources, the uneasiness and disintegration of the human spirit have all been brought about by humanity's trying to accomplish something.
Show me a sane man and I will cure him for you.
If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
He had no enemies, but was intensely disliked by his friends.

I learned to listen with patience and care, and never to interrupt even when people were having great difficulty in explaining themselves, for during such halting and imprecise moments (as the listening skills of my patient mother taught me) people are very revealing - what they hesitate to talk about can tell much about them.

Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no to-morrow. To forget time, to forget life, to be at peace.
Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
We make up horrors to help us cope with the real ones.
To judge an accused King is a duty, to pardon him can be an act of prudence.
Forces beyond your control can take away everything you possess except one thing, your freedom to choose how you will respond to the situation.
Idleness, indifference and irresponsibility are healthy responses to absurd work.
They say if you scratch a cynic you'll find a disappointed idealist.
